content: end of rounds you will be making a square then sew to join and form the sleeve and finally attach a button for closure you can increase/decrease square in 2 different ways on the continuous granny square section at the beginning or the size of the square itself in the crossed stitch section more information in pattern instructions the information inside brackets is all stitches to make in one stitch or space mentioned in pattern the numbers in front of stitches does also indicate the amount of those same stitches referred to make in one stitch or space the information inside square brackets refers to repeated pattern in the round mentioned ©copyright 2023 ana teixeira how to take measurements for your sleeve m1 measure the length of book/device and take a note m2 measure the thickness of m1 book/device and take a note your square size will be the m2 m1 and m2 together while folded forming the sleeve m3 m1 + m2 = size of sleeve from side to side note if you are blocking your square be careful this m3 measurement will stretch use m1 only if your yarn and consequently becoming is stretchy or you are bigger this means if you are blocking the square blocking your square then just use m1 my own measurements inches m1 + m2= 8 25 after blocking i used m1 for my square size side by side while m1= 7 75 m2 0 5 m3 8 25 folded as in picture ©copyright 2023 ana teixeira rounds but make sure to finish with a round that has a multiple of 3 each side example round 7 has 27sts each side where i stopped so 27 is a multiple of 3 but round 8 will have 31sts each side which
